intro: Justicia dives, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in dense, showy clusters. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Justicia dives thrives in full sun to partial shade and is well-suited for tropical and subtropical climates.
